snippet: About four hours before the execution was to take place, the state’s Supreme Court granted a reprieve in response to letters from the Justice Department.
abstract: Mississippi death-row inmate Willie Jerome Manning is granted stay of execution by State Supreme Court just hours before procedure, after Justice Department sends lawyers and officials involved in case several letters disavowing degree of certainty expressed by federal forensic experts at man's trial.
lead_paragraph: About four hours before the execution was to take place, the state’s Supreme Court granted a reprieve in response to letters from the Justice Department.

headline.seo: Willie J. Manning Granted Stay of Execution
headline.main: With Hours to Go, Execution Is Postponed
headline.print_headline: With Hours Left to Go, Execution Is Postponed
